instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Is there a problem reading 2015 Retina 13" Pro SPI ROM chips?
threads.message: I can't get my reader to recognize it. I've had no problems with any other models. Is there something special about these? <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Is there a problem reading 2015 Retina 13" Pro SPI ROM chips?
threads.message: Nothing special besides that they are able to run in quad SPI mode. I have no issue with the TL866

threads.title: [SOLVED]Is there a problem reading 2015 Retina 13" Pro SPI ROM chips?
threads.message: Ok, thanks. Do you know of any how-to guides for the TL866? I've had one sitting here forever but am still doing the PI method.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Is there a problem reading 2015 Retina 13" Pro SPI ROM chips?
threads.message: No idea, you don't need a guide to use the TL866. Have you even tried?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Is there a problem reading 2015 Retina 13" Pro SPI ROM chips?
threads.message: No time to sit and fiddle with it. Not worth it for me. Don't do enough with BIOS reprogramming. Maybe one day.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Is there a problem reading 2015 Retina 13" Pro SPI ROM chips?
threads.message: Takes 10 minutes....this thing is all auto detect.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Is there a problem reading 2015 Retina 13" Pro SPI ROM chips?
threads.message:
Ok, I will. It's hard to stop using what works but is clumsy (PI) but I'll give it a look. Thanks for the input.

As far as this post, you can close it. I removed the chip and read it fine. Not fully sure why - I have some guesses - but I'm not going to worry about it too much.
